info.description: The Pega API provides a set of built-in REST services for Pega applications. All APIs require authentication. Provide the credentials for a Pega operator in the Authorization header for each request. Pega recommends accessing APIs using TLS 1.2.
info.title: PegaAPI

post.summary: Upload a file to be used as an attachment in a subsequent call
post.description: Uploads file to pega database or external storage as configured in application. An unique ID would sent back as response. This ID is needed to attach the uploaded file to a case.

expires.description: Timestamp of expiry of the uploaded file.

post.summary: Attach URL and uploaded file to a case.
post.description: Attaches URL and uploaded file to a case.

parameters.name: requestBody
parameters.description: Attachments details. Note: url field is only required if type is URL

get.summary: Get list of attachments of a case
get.description: Get list of attachments of a case

parameters.name: includeThumbnails
parameters.description: When set to true, thumbnail will be part of response as base 64 encoded string

get.summary: Get list of attachment categories applicable for a case
get.description: Get list of attachments categories
For file attachment content would be sent back as base64 encoded string. For URL, link will be sent in plain text. For correspondence, HTML content would be the response.

content-disposition.description: Contains File name and mime type

transfer-encoding.description: Encoding technique used to encode the reponse. E.g. - base64

delete.description: Link between the case and attachment would be deleted and if attachment doesn't have any other link accessing it, then attachment would be deleted as well.

get.description: Gets the case types from the authenticated user's application.
Gets details about a given case type, including its fields, either with full layout information or as a list.

parameters.name: flatListOfFields
parameters.description: if a flat list without a layout structure is desired, select Full for all UI based attributes or Basic for attributes limited to insure successful validation

put.description: Provide field updates to receive an updated creation page, including its fields.

parameters.name: refreshFor
parameters.description: field (or unique identifier of UI element) triggering refresh

get.description: Returns the authenticated user's list of assignments.
Returns a single assignment's details given its ID (or) Returns the next available assignment for the requestor if 'next' is passed.

post.description: Performs an action on an assignment given its ID and an optional content in the request body.

parameters.name: saveOnly
parameters.description: Save field updates only; not submitting for processing

parameters.name: requestBody
parameters.description: Content should mirror the clipboard structure

get.summary: Get action details as applied to this assignment [DX]
get.description: Returns details about an action that can be performed against this assignment, including its fields, either within the view or as a list.

parameters.name: flatListOfFields
parameters.description: if a flat list without a layout structure is desired, select Full for all UI based attributes or Basic for attributes limited to insure successful validation

put.summary: Refresh action details for this assignment [DX]
put.description: Provide field updates to receive the updated view/fields of this action.

parameters.name: refreshFor
parameters.description: field (or unique identifier of UI element) triggering refresh

get.description: Gets all cases that the authenticated user has created in the default work pool.

post.description:
Creates a new case of the given type. 
The HTTP response header *Location* contains the URI of the newly created case.

parameters.name: requestBody
parameters.description: Input parameters (content, pageInstructions) are needed only for CaseTypes without CreateStage configuration.

Location.description: Contains the URI of the newly created case

ETag.description: Value of the entity tag that must be passed as If-Match header in the request to update case API

get.description: Gets the details of a case given its ID.

ETag.description: Value of the entity tag that must be passed as If-Match header in the request to update case API

put.description: Performs an action given a case ID and an optional content in the request body.

parameters.name: actionID
parameters.description: Local action or a stage local action to perform

parameters.name: If-Match
parameters.description: Value of the entity tag that is received as ETag header in responses to create case and get case details APIs

parameters.name: requestBody
parameters.description: Content should mirror the clipboard structure

ETag.description: Value of the entity tag that must be passed as If-Match header in the request to update case API

get.description: Gets layout details of a page for a given case.
Gets layout details of a view for a given case.

get.summary: Get action details as applied to this case [DX]
get.description: Returns details about an action that can be performed against this case, including its fields, either with full layout information or as a list.

parameters.name: flatListOfFields
parameters.description: if a flat list without a layout structure is desired, select Full for all UI based attributes or Basic for attributes limited to insure successful validation

put.summary: Refresh action details for this case [DX]
put.description: Provide field updates to receive an updated case-wide action view.

parameters.name: refreshFor
parameters.description: field (or unique identifier of UI element) triggering refresh

get.description: Gets all the documents the authenticated user has access to. Use filterBy parameter to retrieve documents by Name (OperatorID?), creation date etc.
Return details of the document for the given document ID”. Note that for documents created by uploading files, this API will only return the metadata. The uploaded file content will not be returned
Retrieve messages for a given context

parameters.name: filterBy
parameters.description: if filtering by context, specify it in filterFor

parameters.name: olderThan
parameters.description: Only return entries older than this date time

parameters.name: requestBody
parameters.description: Fields needed to create a message

get.description: Retrieve notifications

parameters.name: requestBody
parameters.description: Fields needed to create a notification

get.description: Fetches all the spaces present in the application
Get space details

get.summary: Get pins for the given space
get.description: Get pins for the given space

Gets the contents of a data view given its name and parameters.
Parameters are passed in as query string parameters. For example, if you have a data view called D_Customer with parameters "ID" and "Company" you could access the data view with the URL https://myco.org/prweb/api/v1/data/D_Customer?ID=1&Company=MyCo.
"Try it out" note: When testing with "try it out" below you cannot enter values for data view parameters to use as part of the test. This means only data views without required parameters can be tested below.
Gets the metadata of a data view given its name.

applicationIsConstellationCompatible.description: Property indicating whether the application obtaining casetypes is compatible with Constellation, and thus if it can display those casetypes in the Constellation mode.

instruction.description: DELETE, REPLACE, UPDATE are common amongst embedded pages, pagelists & pagegroups. Pagelists also support APPEND, INSERT, & MOVE.  Pagegroups have ADD

target.description: Reference to the embedded page, pagelist, or pagegroup.  Doesn't need to start with a leading dot

listIndex.description: Use this to specify a pagelist index for the DELETE, REPLACE, UPDATE, INSERT, and MOVE instructions

groupIndex.description: Use this to specify a pagegroup subscript for the ADD, DELETE, REPLACE, and UPDATE instructions

listMoveToIndex.description: Use this to specify a pagelist index for the MOVE instruction to indicate the new position

content.description: Content is expected for all instructions except DELETE and MOVE.  REPLACE, ADD, APPEND, and INSERT merge in the pyDefault data transform to the new page

attachmentFieldName.description: Reference to the attachment field property.  Should not start with a leading dot

name.description: Name of the attachment. No need to add this field in request, if name matches uploaded file name

ID.description: ID received upon uploading a file using POST /attachments/upload

delete.description: This should be Include only while submitting form, an already attachment field needs to be cleared. If delete = true, type has to be File along with a valid attachment field name. Not other field should be included in request payload for this attachment.

validationMessages.description: This may be returned by the '.../refresh' apis, if the user's edits caused a non-field-specific error
This may be returned by the '.../refresh' apis, if the user's edits caused a non-field-specific error

titleFormat.description: Format to be applied to the title

containerFormat.description: Format to be applied to container this view is in

title.description: If not blank, title over this layout

titleFormat.description: Format to be applied to the title
Styles are Heading 1, Heading 2, Heading 3, Heading 4, Heading 5, and Heading 6.

groupFormat.description: SCREENLAYOUT can be header, header_footer, footer, content_only, header_left_right, header_left. SIMPLELAYOUT can be Default, Stacked, Inline, Inline grid double, Inline grid triple.

layoutFormat.description: Layouts in the topmost group of a Page use SCREENLAYOUT.  All other layouts can be SIMPLELAYOUT, TABLELAYOUT, or REPEATINGLAYOUT.

title.description: This field is encoded to prevent cross-site scripting

reference.description: Set when the layoutFormat is TABLELAYOUT or REPEATINGLAYOUT.

sourceType.description: Whether this layout is sourced from a property or data page; set when the layoutFormat is TABLELAYOUT or REPEATINGLAYOUT.

referenceType.description: List or Group; set when the layoutFormat is TABLELAYOUT or REPEATINGLAYOUT.

readOnly.description: For pagelist/pagegroup to show as readonly

displayGridHeader.description: For repeat grid, true show header

displayGridFooter.description: For repeat grid, true show footer

testID.description: A unique number that can be used for test referencing, for row it will be appended with -R1, -R2, etc and for RDL it will be appended with -1, -2, etc

groupIndex.description: For a grid populated by a group, where each row has a text-based key

testID.description: A unique number that can be used for test referencing, for row it will be appended with -R1, -R2, etc and for RDL it will be appended with -1, -2, etc

listIndex.description: Replace this row number when inserting a row manually on client For PageList

groupIndex.description: Replace with a row string (group) when inserting a row manually on client For PageGroup

columnImportance.description: Used for the column header layout, a primary column remains when the browser width is shrunk, a secondary column moves into the primary, and other means the column can be lost

captionFor.description: while fields usually have a label as part of them, a caption element may be bound to a field but not part of it

value.description: This field is encoded to prevent cross-site scripting

testID.description: A unique number that can be used for test referencing

columnWidth.description: Width of column, only available if columnImportance has a value

columnUnits.description: Units for column width, blank is px

reference.description: the path in the case hierarchy to this field

validationMessages.example: The child age must be between 0 and 18
validationMessages.description: In the .../refresh APIs, field level errors are returned

validateAs.description: Name of the Edit-Validate rule configured on property rule of this field

name.description: this comes from the property rule of the field

readOnly.description: whether to show this read-only or not

visible.description: whether field should be shown currently or not

labelReserveSpace.description: whether to reserve space for a missing label

label.description: This is the label on the field element in the view.  It is encoded to prevent cross-site scripting.

showLabel.description: only available for pxButton, pxIcon, and pxLink

value.description: This field is encoded to prevent cross-site scripting

maxLength.description: maximum length for the value of this field

expectedLength.description: expected length for the value of this field, useful for identifying how wide the text box should be

isMasked.description: If true, “value” is masked (series of dot)

type.description: the type of control will determine the fields that appear in modes

label.description: label for the button or link.  This field is encoded to prevent cross-site scripting.

rowEditing.description: How to edit rows in a repeating layoutNOTE: if readOnly, then all fields will besent as readOnly

editingInlineType.description: Available when rowEditing is 'row'; row means click to edit, readWrite means inline editable

tooltip.description: This is encoded to prevent cross-site scripting

listSource.description: used with controls pxAutoComplete/pxDropDown/pxRadioButtons; list can be sourced from promptlist, locallist, or datapage

loadMode.description: When “auto”, datapage and clipboard page will be loaded inline into options, otherwise, need to retrieve manually

options.description: used with controls pxAutoComplete/pxDropDown/pxRadioButtons; when listSource is set to promptlist or locallist, contains the dropdown contents

dataPageID.description: used with controls pxAutoComplete/pxDropDown/pxRadioButtons; when listSource is set to datapage

dataPageValue.description: used with controls pxAutoComplete/pxDropDown/pxRadioButtons; when listSource is set to datapage, field in the data page response to use for the value

dataPagePrompt.description: used with controls pxAutoComplete/pxDropDown/pxRadioButtons; when listSource is set to datapage, field in the data page response to use for the prompt

useFutureDateRange.description: If true, have a future data range

usePastDateRange.description: If true, have a past data range

iconSource.description: used with control pxIcon to determine its image source

iconStandard.description: used with control pxIcon, when iconSource is standardicon

iconImage.description: used with control pxIcon, when iconSource is image

iconUrl.description: used with control pxIcon, when iconSource is exturl

iconProperty.description: used with control pxIcon, when iconSource is property

iconStyle.description: used with control pxIcon, when iconSource is styleclass

imageStyle.description: If styleclass, then class for icon (pi pi-home, etc.)

placeholder.description: placeholder text, typically used with a dropdown where a choice hasn't been made yet

displayWithReadOnlyFormat.description: Use Readonly format when displaying data in control that is editable

hasSeparators.description: If true, have separators in number for 1000s, etc

autoPrepend.description: Value to put before the number

showValueAs.description: Show true/false as text or an image

orientation.description: used with control pxRadioButtons, either 'vertical' or 'horizontal'

wrapAfter.description: used with control pxRadioButtons, the number of radio buttons after which it wraps, so if the value is 3 and there are 5 buttons the first row would have 3, the second 2

allowTextEntry.description: if true allow text entry of date, if false use the calendar icon

refreshFor.description: either name of control or unique ID

customTemplate.description: Name for template (look) for a localAction

lastSavedValue.description: The last saved value is encoded to protect against cross-site scripting
The last saved value is encoded to protect against cross-site scripting

value.description: Will be the same as the key for a locallist, but different for a promptlist
This is typically html content.  It is encoded to prevent against cross-site scripting.

message.example: I think that's a good idea

documentContent.example: Pegasystems Inc. is the leader in software for customer engagement and operational excellence. Pega’s adaptive, cloud-architected software – built on its unified Pega Platform™ – empowers people to rapidly deploy and easily extend and change applications to meet strategic business needs. Over its 35-year history, Pega has delivered award-winning capabilities in CRM and digital process automation (DPA) powered by advanced artificial intelligence and robotic automation, to help the world’s leading brands achieve breakthrough business results.

description.example: This page contains data explorer information to be displayed

ID.description: ID received upon uploading a file using POST /attachments/upload

rel.description: Relation of this link to attachment

canView.description: User has access to view attachment of this category

canDeleteOwn.description: User has access to delete attachment(added by same user) of this category

canEdit.description: User has access to edit attachment of this category

canCreate.description: User has access to add attachment of this category

canDeleteAll.description: User has access to delete attachment of this category
